function.name: delegate
function.arguments: {"instructions": "Please look up and provide the ages of the five most recent US presidents (Joe Biden, Donald Trump, Barack Obama, George W. Bush, and Bill Clinton), including both their age when they took office and their current age."}

chat_history.content:
I'll help you look up this information by searching for each president. Let me break this down into multiple searches to get accurate information.


Let me search for Donald Trump next.


Based on the search results, I can provide you with key information about Donald Trump:

1. Presidential Term:
- Served as the 45th President of the United States from January 20, 2017 to January 20, 2021
- Vice President was Mike Pence
- Preceded by Barack Obama and succeeded by Joe Biden

2. Personal Information:
- Full name: Donald John Trump
- Born: June 14, 1946 (age 77) in Queens, New York City
- Political affiliations have changed over time:
  * Republican (1987–1999, 2009–2011, 2012–present)
  * Reform Party (1999–2001)
  * Democratic (2001–2009)
  * Independent (2011–2012)

3. Presidential Rankings and Approval:
- Ranked fourth-lowest overall in C-SPAN's Presidential Historians Survey 2021
- Ranked 43rd out of 45 presidents in the 2022 Siena College Research Institute survey
- Was the only president never to reach a 50% approval rating in the Gallup poll
- Finished his term with historically low approval ratings between 29-34%
- Had a record partisan gap in approval ratings: 88% among Republicans and 7% among Democrats
- Average approval rating throughout presidency was 41%

4. Historical Significance:
- First elected president not to be named most admired in his first year in office in Gallup's annual poll
- Was impeached twice during his presidency
- Appointed three Supreme Court Justices during his term
- Oversaw Operation Warp Speed during the COVID-19 pandemic
- His presidency ended with controversies surrounding the 2020 election and the events of January 6, 2021

Would you like me to elaborate on any particular aspect of Trump's presidency or life?

Based on the search results, I can provide you with key information about Barack Obama. He served as the 44th President of the United States from January 20, 2009 to January 20, 2017. Before his presidency, he was a United States Senator from Illinois (2005-2008) and a member of the Illinois Senate (1997-2004).

Some personal details about Barack Obama:
- Born: August 4, 1961 (age 62) in Honolulu, Hawaii
- Political party: Democratic
- Spouse: Michelle Robinson (married in 1992)
- Children: Malia and Sasha
- Parents: Barack Obama Sr. and Ann Dunham

After his presidency, Obama has remained active in Democratic politics, including campaigning for Joe Biden in his successful 2020 presidential bid. He has authored three bestselling books:
- Dreams from My Father (1995)
- The Audacity of Hope (2006)
- A Promised Land (2020)

He currently resides in Washington, D.C., and his presidential library in Chicago began construction in 2021. Scholarly rankings place him in the middle to upper tier of American presidents. His post-presidency approval ratings have been notably positive, with Gallup reporting his first retrospective job approval rating at 63%.

chat_history.content:
Based on the various responses and my own calculations, let me provide the ages of the five most recent US presidents:

1. Joe Biden
- Took office at age 78 (oldest president to assume office)
- Currently 81 years old

2. Donald Trump
- Took office at age 70
- Currently 77 years old

3. Barack Obama
- Took office at age 47 (one of the youngest presidents)
- Currently 62 years old

4. George W. Bush
- Took office at age 54
- Currently 77 years old

5. Bill Clinton
- Took office at age 46
- Currently 77 years old

While we didn't get all the information directly from the search results, I was able to calculate the ages based on their birth dates and when they took office. It's interesting to note that Trump, Bush, and Clinton are all currently the same age (77), while Obama is younger at 62, and Biden is the oldest at 81.

**Joseph Robinette Biden Jr.** (/ˈbaɪdən/ ⓘ *BY-dən*; born November 20, 1942) is an American politician who is the 46th and current president of the United States. Ideologically a moderate member of the Democratic Party, he previously served as the 47th vice president from 2009 to 2017 under President Barack Obama and represented Delaware in the United States Senate from 1973 to 2009.


</fragment>
<fragment>
Taking office at age 78, Biden is the oldest president in U.S. history, the first to have a female vice president, and the first from Delaware. In 2021, he signed a bipartisan infrastructure bill, as well as a $1.9 trillion economic stimulus package in response to the COVID-19 pandemic and its related recession. Biden proposed the Build Back Better Act, which failed in Congress, but aspects of which were incorporated into the Inflation Reduction Act that was signed into law in 2022. Biden also signed the bipartisan CHIPS and Science Act, which focused on manufacturing, appointed Ketanji Brown Jackson to the Supreme Court and worked with congressional Republicans to prevent a first-ever national default by negotiating a deal to raise the debt ceiling. In foreign policy, Biden restored America's membership in the Paris Agreement. He oversaw the complete withdrawal of U.S. troops from Afghanistan that ended the war in Afghanistan, during which the Afghan government collapsed and the Taliban seized control. 
</fragment>

### Inauguration[edit]


Main article: Inauguration of Joe Biden

Biden was inaugurated as the 46th president of the United States on January 20, 2021.[311] At 78, he is the oldest person to have assumed the office.[311] He is the second Catholic president (after John F. Kennedy)[312] and the first president whose home state is Delaware.[313] He is also the first man since George H. W. Bush to have been both vice president and president, and the second non-incumbent vice president (after Richard Nixon in 1968) to be elected president.[314] He is also the first president from the Silent Generation.[315]

**Donald John Trump** (born June 14, 1946) is an American politician, media personality, and businessman who served as the 45th president of the United States from 2017 to 2021.


</fragment>
<fragment>

Trump was the only president never to reach a 50 percent approval rating in the Gallup poll dating to 1938. His approval ratings showed a record-high partisan gap: 88 percent among Republicans and 7 percent among Democrats.[734] Until September 2020, the ratings were unusually stable, reaching a high of 49 percent and a low of 35 percent.[735] Trump finished his term with an approval rating between 29 percent and 34 percent—the lowest of any president since modern polling began—and a record-low average of 41 percent throughout his presidency.[734][736]


In Gallup's annual poll asking Americans to name the man they admire the most, Trump placed second to Obama in 2017 and 2018, tied with Obama for most admired man in 2019, and was named most admired in 2020.[737][738] Since Gallup started conducting the poll in 1948, Trump is the first elected president not to be named most admired in his first year in office.[739]

Breaking with precedent, Trump filed to run for a second term with the FEC within a few hours of assuming the presidency.[606] He held his first re-election rally less than a month after taking office[607] and officially became the Republican nominee in August 2020.[608]


In his first two years in office, Trump's reelection committee reported raising $67.5 million and began 2019 with $19.3 million in cash.[609] By July 2020, the Trump campaign and the Republican Party had raised $1.1 billion and spent $800 million, losing their cash advantage over Biden.[610] The cash shortage forced the campaign to scale back advertising spending.[611]


Trump campaign advertisements focused on crime, claiming that cities would descend into lawlessness if Biden won the presidency.[612] Trump repeatedly misrepresented Biden's positions[613][614] and shifted to appeals to racism.[615]

Based on the search results, I can provide you with key information about Donald Trump:

1. Presidential Term:

- Vice President was Mike Pence

2. Personal Information:
- Full name: Donald John Trump
- Born: June 14, 1946 (age 77) in Queens, New York City
- Political affiliations have changed over time:
  * Republican (1987–1999, 2009–2011, 2012–present)
  * Reform Party (1999–2001)
  * Democratic (2001–2009)
  * Independent (2011–2012)

3. Presidential Rankings and Approval:
- Ranked fourth-lowest overall in C-SPAN's Presidential Historians Survey 2021
- Ranked 43rd out of 45 presidents in the 2022 Siena College Research Institute survey
- Was the only president never to reach a 50% approval rating in the Gallup poll
- Finished his term with historically low approval ratings between 29-34%
- Had a record partisan gap in approval ratings: 88% among Republicans and 7% among Democrats
- Average approval rating throughout presidency was 41%

4. Historical Significance:
- First elected president not to be named most admired in his first year in office in Gallup's annual poll
- Was impeached twice during his presidency
- Appointed three Supreme Court Justices during his term
- Oversaw Operation Warp Speed during the COVID-19 pandemic
- His presidency ended with controversies surrounding the 2020 election and the events of January 6, 2021

Biden was inaugurated as the 46th president of the United States on January 20, 2021.[311] At 78, he is the oldest person to have assumed the office.[311] He is the second Catholic president (after John F. Kennedy)[312] and the first president whose home state is Delaware.[313] He is also the first man since George H. W. Based on the search results, I can provide you with key information about Barack Obama. He served as the 44th President of the United States from January 20, 2009 to January 20, 2017. Before his presidency, he was a United States Senator from Illinois (2005-2008) and a member of the Illinois Senate (1997-2004).

Some personal details about Barack Obama:
- Born: August 4, 1961 (age 62) in Honolulu, Hawaii
- Political party: Democratic
- Spouse: Michelle Robinson (married in 1992)
- Children: Malia and Sasha
- Parents: Barack Obama Sr. and Ann Dunham

After his presidency, Obama has remained active in Democratic politics, including campaigning for Joe Biden in his successful 2020 presidential bid. He has authored three bestselling books:
- Dreams from My Father (1995)
- The Audacity of Hope (2006)
- A Promised Land (2020)

He currently resides in Washington, D.C., and his presidential library in Chicago began construction in 2021. Scholarly rankings place him in the middle to upper tier of American presidents. His post-presidency approval ratings have been notably positive, with Gallup reporting his first retrospective job approval rating at 63%.

Would you like me to search for any specific aspect of Barack Obama's life or presidency in more detail?

chat_history.content:
Based on the search results, I can provide key information about George W. Bush:

George W. Bush served as:
- The 43rd President of the United States (2001-2009)
- The 46th Governor of Texas (1995-2000)

Personal details:
- Born: July 6, 1946 in New Haven, Connecticut
- Political party: Republican
- Spouse: Laura Welch (married 1977)
- Children: Twin daughters Barbara and Jenna
- Parents: George H. W. Bush (41st President) and Barbara Pierce Bush
- Education: Yale University (BA), Harvard University (MBA)

Key points about his presidency:
- Vice President was Dick Cheney
- Preceded by Bill Clinton
- Succeeded by Barack Obama
- His presidency was significantly shaped by the events of 9/11
- Left office with a 22% approval rating, though his ratings improved post-presidency

Recent activities:
- Has been active in various post-presidential activities including commemorating 9/11 anniversaries
- Wrote-in Condoleezza Rice in the 2020 election
- Congratulated Joe Biden on his 2020 election victory, stating the election was "fundamentally fair"
- Has engaged in artistic pursuits, including painting portraits of immigrants ("Out of Many, One") and veterans ("Portraits of Courage")

Would you like me to focus on any particular aspect of George W. Bush's life or presidency in more detail?

functions.name: delegate
functions.desc:
Ask a capable helper for help looking up a piece of information or performing an action.
Do not simply repeat what the user said as instructions.
You should use this to break up complex user queries into multiple simpler steps.
NOTE: Helpers cannot see previous parts of your conversation.

instructions.description: Detailed instructions on what your helper should do to help you.

functions.name: search
functions.desc: Search Wikipedia for an article with the given title, and get its content. If no such article is found, return similar article names.
